question: I have had this diagnosis for almost 25 years now - following 2 successful back surgeries and one traumatic insult due to domestic violence.  Had a subarachnoid bleed, was not ambulartory for almost a year - in fact was told I was a spastic para - but learned how to walk again and still do with varying degrees of mobility.  At first mostly left leg involved - no reflexes  now my right leg also involved with slow reflexes.  Chronic pain - Darvon and  Motrin used.  Have to catheterize spastic neurogenic bladder with reconstuction, have some degree of Autonomic Dysreflexia, also Thoracic Outlet Syndrome and C5 and 6 discs.  I am having overwhelming episodes (very intermittent) of such fatique that I lose any muscle tone I have and feel as if my next breath is just too difficult and too much effort to take.  Elevated CPK, no diabetes, no cardiac or hypertensive hx.  Any thoughts or help with this strange thing happening??
title: Chronic adhesive Spinal Arachnoiditis
